text.__SUMMARY__: Hypericum naudinianum is a perennial herb in the genus Hypericum, in the section Adenosepalum.
text.Description: The species grows to be 1.5 meters tall. Its stems are reddish brown and its leaves are sessile. It has obtuse flowers that are 15-17mm in diameter. The petals are described as "clear butter yellow" and are veined red.
text.Distribution:
Hypericum naudinianum is found in Algeria and Morocco near streamsides and waterfalls.
